summary: This is an email from August 12, 2019, regarding an incident report for Jeffrey Epstein for 'self-mutilation' on July 23, 2019. The report was expunged on August 1, 2019, due to insufficient evidence. The email also discusses the status of Epstein's central file and the search for documentation regarding his housing conditions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the incident report for self-mutilation on July 23, 2019, and a pretrial inmate whose central file is being discussed.

persons.name: Disciplinary Hearing Officer
persons.context: The officer who expunged the incident report against Jeffrey Epstein on August 1, 2019, and signed the decision on August 2, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Self-Mutilation Incident
events.description: An incident report was filed for Jeffrey Epstein for code 228, Self Mutilation.

events.title: Incident Report Expunged
events.description: The Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) expunged the self-mutilation incident report against Jeffrey Epstein based on insufficient evidence.

events.title: DHO Signs Expungement
events.description: The Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) signed the decision to expunge the incident report.

keyFacts: An incident report was filed against Jeffrey Epstein for 'self-mutilation' on July 23, 2019, while he was a pretrial inmate.
The incident report was expunged by a Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) on August 1, 2019, due to 'insufficient evidence'.
Epstein's central file contained limited information because he was a pretrial inmate, and there was no documentation concerning his need to be housed with a cellmate.
The email indicates an ongoing search for evidence that a unit officer had regarding Epstein's housing, beyond verbal instructions.
The document is dated August 12, 2019, which is shortly before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, making it a contemporaneous record of his jail conditions.
